PICRUSt analysis was performed to predict metagenomic functional content based on the software package (PICRUSt v1. 0. 0)
70 . This approach exploits the relationship between phylogeny and function by combining 16â€‰s data with a database of reference genomes (Greengenes) to predict the presence of gene families. The 16S rDNA sequences were clustered into a collection of OTUs using a closed-reference OUT picking protocol (QIIME1.8.0)
71 . The obtained OUT table was normalized by 16S rRNA gene copy number, and then used to predict metagenomic functional content based on the PICRUSt software package
70 . Functional predictions were exported as KEGG orthologs.
